title: Sensitive Information Leaking Through DoD Owned Website. [██████████]
content:
Summary
While performing recon work on websites owned by DoD i came up with ██████████ website which is leaking sensitive information.
Description
The above website is leaking information such as- first name and last name, email address, phone number, house address and organization name of attendees in a clear readable pdf document. This is a high severity issue and requires immediate fixation. It is also a clear privacy violation and insufficient protection mechanism involved in data storage. I look forward for a satisfactory reply from your side.
Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Open a web browser of your choice.
Now open this URL: https://██████/12038/MyDoD/ngb-sfpd-roster.pdf
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Remove document from the internet or put applicable authorization mechanism(s) in order to access sensitive documents.
Impact
Any person can access this document and cause information leakage, target specific person for crime.
Anyone can threaten ██████ employees to reveal secrets which aren't meant to be public by nature.
steps: Open a web browser of your choice.
vuln_description: The website is leaking sensitive information such as first name, last name, email address, phone number, house address, and organization name of attendees in a publicly accessible PDF document. This constitutes a high severity information disclosure issue and a privacy violation due to insufficient protection mechanisms.
reason: The vulnerability was discovered through straightforward reconnaissance work, involving accessing a publicly available PDF document without any need for complex interactions, state manipulation, or novel logic. The discovery primarily required knowledge of the target domain and basic web browsing skills.
